column5: looking to go perch fishing on Erie soon...could use a ultralight as the rest of my gear is kinda heavy ...any suggestions

Maybe worth checking one of these out. Picked up a 7ft UL years ago for 40 bucks, hard to beat for the money.  http://www.basspro.com/Bass-Pro-Shops-Micro-Lite-Graphite-Spinning-Rods/product/10204875/
Check out Rapala F2 ultralight rods, nice crisp action, 4 models to choose from,
I picked up a St. Croix Panfish series rod last year.  6' UL paired with a Rapala R-Type spinning reel.  Awesome rod I have to admit.

Don't go really noodly on the rod, perch on Erie are frequently in 40 feet of water , 1/2 oz. sinker and long hooksets are better with a stiffer action .  edit: the ultra lite I use on small creek trout is not the one I use on Erie perch.
Thanks for the suggestions fellas appreciate it ...love my St Croixs ..anyone  use the Browning Rods from Bass pro..Dave so your saying just bring my walleye gear maybe ?

Thanks for the suggestions fellas appreciate it ...love my St Croixs ..anyone  use the Browning Rods from Bass pro..Dave so your saying just bring my walleye gear maybe ?  My Erie perch rod is an ancient 5 1/4 foot one piece, Fenwick HMG, very light but rated for 1/4 to 5/8oz wts. paired up with an ultralite reel and braid , I find it ideal.

Don't go really noodly on the rod, perch on Erie are frequently in 40 feet of water , 1/2 oz. sinker and long hooksets are better with a stiffer action .  edit: the ultra lite I use on small creek trout is not the one I use on Erie perch. i agree i use my med light fast action on erie  st croix 7 ft light fast action panfish rod is my fav for shallower water, it will drop shot or throw small cranks for crappie. i don't use ul rods much because they don't really have much feel
ok guys thanks ill just use one of my medium rods
